input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command.
Sets the number of minutes to wait before ending a user's session with a server when the user account or valid logon time expires.
Performs the operation on the specified domain controller otherwise, the operation is performed on the host computer specified within the ConnectionDetails concept. Valid values: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Linux.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on SunOS.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">net accounts </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${force logoff}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/forcelogoff:${force logoff}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${domain}')!=0 and '${domain}' ='true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /domain</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Update Force Logoff Sets the number of minutes to wait before ending a Windows user's session with a server when the user account or valid logon time expires.
